Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "README support (rebase, cleanup and polish)" (#4595) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
PR base is 'dev', but I'll be merging to 'feature-readme' on completion until we have OSS approval.

I'm also doing this to preserve authors for 93233d4  (@fayrose) and a994621 (@JarahSi). On merge, I plan to squash PR commits, except these. Note that these 2 commits were PR'd, but I'm including them for completeness due to merge conflicts and other changes.

Scope: This PR is solely for cleanup and polishing of the feature as-is. I expect another PR to cover changes for security (mini-markdown/encoding) or feature modifications (i.e., registration/version scoping, repoURL).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Remove redesign banner configuration" (#4691) at NuGet/NuGetGallery

Now that the redesign is live, there's no need for there to be a banner warning users about the redesign.

We could consider changing the configuration into "InformationBanner" or something similar instead of removing it entirely.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add package auditing for HasReadMe field" (#4247) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "Add database schema and entities for validation flow" (#4690) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Address https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/4651.

The resulting SQL is:
```sql
CREATE TABLE [dbo].[PackageValidationSets] (
    [Key] [bigint] NOT NULL IDENTITY,
    [ValidationTrackingId] [uniqueidentifier] NOT NULL,
    [PackageKey] [int] NOT NULL,
    [RowVersion] rowversion NOT NULL,
    [Created] [datetime2](7) NOT NULL,
    [Updated] [datetime2](7) NOT NULL,
    CONSTRAINT [PK_dbo.PackageValidationSets] PRIMARY KEY ([Key])
)

CREATE UNIQUE INDEX [IX_ValidationTrackingId] ON [dbo].[PackageValidationSets]([ValidationTrackingId])

CREATE INDEX [IX_PackageKey] ON [dbo].[PackageValidationSets]([PackageKey])

CREATE TABLE [dbo].[PackageValidations] (
    [Key] [uniqueidentifier] NOT NULL DEFAULT newsequentialid(),
    [PackageValidationSetKey] [bigint] NOT NULL,
    [Type] [varchar](255) NOT NULL,
    [ValidationStatusKey] [int] NOT NULL,
    [ValidationStatusTimestamp] [datetime2](7) NOT NULL,
    CONSTRAINT [PK_dbo.PackageValidations] PRIMARY KEY ([Key])
)

CREATE INDEX [IX_PackageValidationSetKey] ON [dbo].[PackageValidations]([PackageValidationSetKey])

ALTER TABLE [dbo].[PackageValidationSets] ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_dbo.PackageValidationSets_dbo.Packages_PackageKey] FOREIGN KEY ([PackageKey]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Packages] ([Key]) ON DELETE CASCADE

ALTER TABLE [dbo].[PackageValidations] ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_dbo.PackageValidations_dbo.PackageValidationSets_PackageValidationSetKey] FOREIGN KEY ([PackageValidationSetKey]) REFERENCES [dbo].[PackageValidationSets] ([Key]) ON DELETE CASCADE
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Feature request: Improve NuGet pack error messages" (#5900) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
Feature request (not a bug).

NuGet product used: NuGet.exe

NuGet version: 4.3.0.3

VS version: Visual Studio 2017

OS version: Windows 10

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: Not applicable, New feature request

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

Would like errors to look like a standard compiler error to make parsing in wrapper tools easier.

Here are some examples:

Foo.cs(267,17): error CS0246: The type or namespace name 'foo' could not be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)
Foo.cs(269,17): error CS0128: A local variable or function named 'nuGetVersionsXmlBlock' is already defined in this scope

The basic format is this:
<optional error location info>: error <unique error code>: <error message>

Any of these should be valid errors:
Foo.nuspec(10,1): error NU0001: Invalid XML tag <bar>
error NU0002: Unable to create a\b\c\foo.nupkg. Directory not found.
error NU0003: Flux capacitor not charged. Please accelerate to 88 mph before attempting to see any “serious stuff”.

The “unique error code” is just something unique to any given tool (thus the suggested NU prefix) and unique per error message. The idea is that you can Bing for the eror code and find the docs for it, so you can find a fix.

## Other suggested things
Some tools use the error code numbers to give more info, such as the compiler. The first number aligns with the error level, so that C1xxx errors are all level 1 errors, C2xxx are all level 2, etc. IIRC, if they issue a warning or an error for the same issue, it has the same unique code, and just changes the initial bit from from “error” to “warning”.

### Verbose Logs

Not applicable

### Sample Project

Not applicable

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet packages referenced via PackageReference don't include DLLs in VSIX" (#5899) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Summary

When building a VSIX that references NuGet packages, users used to be able to easily include the assembly included in the NuGet packages by setting <CopyLocal> to true on the reference. The VSSDK build tasks search through the @(ReferencePath) item for any reference that has CopyLocal set to true and then includes
[msbuild.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/1307682/msbuild.zip)
 those references in the VSIX.

PackageReferences don't give the option to the user to set CopyLocal to true, so it's difficult for the average user to get a NuGet reference included in a VSIX.

I've attached a binary log from a build of a VSIX that's created via the repro steps. Let me know if you need any info - we're willing to make changes in the VSSDK to support this if need be (as long as the changes are backwards compatible, of course).

## Repro steps
1. Create a new VSIXProject
2. Make sure "PackageReference" is enabled by default by selecting Tools > NuGet Package Manager > Package Manager Settings.. and setting "Default package management format" to "PackageReference".
3. Right click on the VSIXProject and select "Manage NuGet packages"
4. Add a NuGet package that has a DLL (e.g. NuGet.VisualStudio).
5. Build the VSIXProject.
**Expected**: NuGet.VisualStudio.dll is included in the VSIX.
**Actual**: The VSIX does not contain NuGet.VisualStudio.dll.

## Workaround
A workaround is available for VSIX developers:
```xml
<Target Name="IncludePackageReferenceDependencies" AfterTargets="GetVsixSourceItems">
  <ItemGroup>
    <VSIXSourceItem Include="@(ReferencePath)" Condition="$([System.String]::new('%(ReferencePath.FusionName)').StartsWith('NuGet.VisualStudio'))" />
  </ItemGroup>
</Target>
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Subdirectories are ignored when including files without extension" (#5898) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
(I'll try to fix this and I know where the problem is, but if this behaviour is expected and this isn't a bug, please point me in the right direction. The behaviour is expressed in this statement: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack/PackTaskLogic.cs#L426)

If I add this to my project file:

<Content Include="tools\**">
    <CopyToOutputDirectory>Always</CopyToOutputDirectory>
    <Pack>True</Pack>
    <PackagePath>tools\</PackagePath>
</Content>

And I have for example these files:

    tools\folder1\file1.cs
    tools\folder2\file2.cs
    tools\folder2\file (no extension)

"file" will be copied to "tools\", while "file1.cs" will be copied to "tools\folder1\" and "file2.cs" will be copied to "tools\folder2\"

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Announcing the NuGet 'Announcements' repo!" (#1) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
| Spec wiki| Discussion issue| 
| ------------- |:-------------| 
| _None_| https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/4088|

## Announcing the **Announcements** repo!
As a step towards engaging with the community early on, we have created the **NuGet/Announcements** repo to propose new features and to get early feedback before the team starts implementing these features. This repo will be used for team announcements only. To file a bug or start a discussion, please create a new issue on [NuGet client](https://github.com/nuget/home/issues) or [NuGet server](https://github.com/nuget/NuGetGallery/issues). .

All items posted to this repo are locked, but will typically have links to separate discussion threads on one of the NuGet repos, just like this announcement can be discussed more on this issue: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/4088. 
Please use these discussion threads for questions and comments about a particular announcement.

## Receiving Notifications

Subscribe to this repo to be notified about major changes, upcoming features and other noteworthy announcements in NuGet.

![subscribe](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14800916/29544263-bea081fa-869b-11e7-9c18-b576890ba049.png)

## Using the Issues list

Use the [Feature](https://github.com/nuget/Announcements/labels/Feature) and [Breaking Change](https://github.com/nuget/Announcements/labels/Breaking%20Change) labels to see what's new and changed.

New feature announcements will have one of the following labels:
* [Reviewing](https://github.com/nuget/Announcements/labels/Reviewing) - Feature being proposed and is undergoing review within the team and the community. 
* [Reviewed](https://github.com/nuget/Announcements/labels/Reviewed) - Feature has been reviewed and necessary feedback incorporated. The feature is ready to be implemented.
* [Implemented](https://github.com/nuget/Announcements/labels/Implemented) - Feature has been implemented.
